00120 typedef unsigned long xnarch_cpumask_t;
00121 #define xnarch_num_online_cpus()         XNARCH_NR_CPUS
00122 #define xnarch_cpu_online_map            ((1<<xnarch_num_online_cpus()) - 1)
00123 #define xnarch_cpu_set(cpu, mask)        ((mask) |= 1 << (cpu))
00124 #define xnarch_cpu_clear(cpu, mask)      ((mask) &= 1 << (cpu))
00125 #define xnarch_cpus_clear(mask)          ((mask) = 0UL)
00126 #define xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, mask)      (!!((mask) & (1 << (cpu))))
00127 #define xnarch_cpus_and(dst, src1, src2) ((dst) = (src1) & (src2))
00128 #define xnarch_cpus_equal(mask1, mask2)  ((mask1) == (mask2))
00129 #define xnarch_cpus_empty(mask)          ((mask) == 0UL)
00130 #define xnarch_cpumask_of_cpu(cpu)       (1 << (cpu))
00131 #define xnarch_first_cpu(mask)           (ffnz(mask))
00132 #define XNARCH_CPU_MASK_ALL              (~0UL)
00133 
00134 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00135                                                 unsigned long uld,
00136                                                 unsigned long *rem)
00137 {
00138     if (rem)
00139         *rem = ull % uld;
00140 
00141     return ull / uld;
00142 }

00144 static inline unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00145     return ffs((int)word) - 1;
00146 }

00153 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00154 
00155     const char *name;           /* Symbolic name of thread (can be NULL) */
00156     struct xnthread *thread;    /* VM thread pointer (opaque) */
00157     void *khandle;              /* Kernel handle (opaque) */
00158     void (*entry)(void *);      /* Thread entry */
00159     void *cookie;               /* Thread cookie passed on entry */
00160     int imask;                  /* Initial interrupt mask */
00161     jmp_buf rstenv;             /* Restart context info */
00162     pid_t ppid;
00163     int syncflag;
00164     pthread_t thid;
00165 
00166     /* The following fields are not used by the Fusion skin, however
00167        they are set by the nucleus. */
00168     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00169     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00170 
00171 } xnarchtcb_t;

00194 static inline int __attribute__ ((unused))
00195 xnarch_read_environ (const char *name, const char **ptype, void *pvar)
00196 
00197 {
00198     char *value;
00199 
00200     if (*ptype == NULL)
00201         return 0;       /* Already read in */
00202 
00203     *ptype = NULL;
00204 
00205     value = getenv(name);
00206 
00207     if (!value)
00208         return -1;
00209 
00210     if (**ptype == 's')
00211         *((char **)pvar) = value;
00212     else
00213         *((int *)pvar) = atoi(value);
00214 
00215     return 1;
00216 }
00217 
00218 static int inline xnarch_lock_irq (void) {
00219 
00220     return xnarch_atomic_xchg(&vml_irqlock,1);
00221 }
00222 
00223 static inline void xnarch_unlock_irq (int x) {
00224 
00225     extern int vml_irqpend;
00226 
00227     if (!x && vml_irqlock)
00228         {
00229         if (xnarch_atomic_xchg(&vml_irqpend,0))
00230             __pthread_release_vm(&vml_irqlock);
00231         else
00232             vml_irqlock = 0;
00233         }
00234 }

00248 int vml_irqlock = 0;
00249 
00250 int vml_irqpend = 0;
00251 
00252 void xnarch_sync_irq (void)
00253 
00254 {
00255     if (vml_irqlock)
00256         __pthread_hold_vm(&vml_irqpend);
00257 }

00259 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00260                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00261                                                    void *cookie),
00262                                    void *cookie) {
00263     if (irq == 0)
00264         return -EINVAL; /* Reserved for the timer thread. */
00265 
00266     return -ENOSYS;
00267 }

00321 static void xnarch_restart_handler (int sig) {
00322 
00323     longjmp(vml_current->rstenv,1);
00324 }
00325 
00326 void xnarch_exit_handler (int sig)
00327 
00328 {
00329     vml_done = 1;
00330     __pthread_activate_vm(vml_root->khandle,vml_current->khandle);
00331     exit(99);
00332 }
00333 
00334 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
00335 
00336 {
00337     struct sigaction sa;
00338     int err;
00339 
00340     if (geteuid() !=0)
00341         {
00342         fprintf(stderr,"This program must be run with root privileges");
00343         exit(1);
00344         }
00345 
00346     err = __xeno_main_init();
00347 
00348     if (err)
00349         {
00350         fprintf(stderr,"main_init() failed, err=%x\n",err);
00351         exit(2);
00352         }
00353 
00354     err = __xeno_skin_init();
00355 
00356     if (err)
00357         {
00358         fprintf(stderr,"skin_init() failed, err=%x\n",err);
00359         exit(3);
00360         }
00361 
00362     err = __xeno_user_init();
00363 
00364     if (err)
00365         {
00366         fprintf(stderr,"user_init() failed, err=%x\n",err);
00367         exit(4);
00368         }
00369 
00370     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_restart_handler;
00371     sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00372     sa.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
00373     sigaction(XNARCH_SIG_RESTART,&sa,NULL);
00374 
00375     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_exit_handler;
00376     sa.sa_flags = 0;
00377     sigaction(SIGTERM,&sa,NULL);
00378     sigaction(SIGHUP,&sa,NULL);
00379     sigaction(SIGINT,&sa,NULL);
00380 
00381     while (!vml_done)
00382         __pthread_idle_vm(&vml_irqlock);
00383 
00384     __xeno_user_exit();
00385     __xeno_skin_exit();
00386     __xeno_main_exit();
00387 
00388     exit(0);
00389 }
00390 
00391 #endif  /* !XENO_MAIN_MODULE */

00399 }

00401 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00402     __pthread_cancel_vm(vml_timer_handle,NULL);
00403 }

00405 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00407 #ifdef XENO_POD_MODULE
00408 
00409 extern void *vml_timer_handle;
00410 
00411 xnsysinfo_t vml_info;
00412 
00413 xnarchtcb_t *vml_root;
00414 
00415 xnarchtcb_t *vml_current;
00416 
00417 /* NOTES:
00418 
00419    o IRQ threads have no TCB, since they are not known by the VM
00420    abstraction.
00421 
00422    o All in-kernel IRQ threads serving the VM have the same priority
00423    level, except when they wait on a synchonization barrier.
00424 
00425    o In theory, the IRQ synchronization mechanism might end up
00426    causing interrupt loss, since we might be sleeping to much waiting
00427    on the irqlock barrier until it is signaled. In practice, this
00428    should not happen because interrupt-free sections are short thanks
00429    to the mutex scheme.
00430 */
00431 
00432 struct xnarch_tick_parms {
00433     time_t sec;
00434     long nsec;
00435     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00436     pid_t ppid;
00437     int syncflag;
00438 };
00439 
00440 static void *xnarch_timer_thread (void *cookie)
00441 
00442 {
00443     struct xnarch_tick_parms *p = (struct xnarch_tick_parms *)cookie;
00444     void (*tickhandler)(void) = p->tickhandler;
00445     struct timespec ts;
00446 
00447     pthread_create_rt("vmtimer",NULL,p->ppid,&p->syncflag,&vml_timer_handle);
00448     pthread_migrate_rt(FUSION_RTAI_DOMAIN);
00449 
00450     ts.tv_sec = p->sec;
00451     ts.tv_nsec = p->nsec;
00452 
00453     for (;;)
00454         {
00455         nanosleep(&ts,NULL);
00456         xnarch_sync_irq();
00457         tickhandler(); /* Should end up in xnintr_clock_handler() here. */
00458         }
00459 
00460     return NULL;
00461 }
00462 
00463 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long nstick,
00464                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00465 {
00466     struct xnarch_tick_parms parms;
00467     struct sched_param param;
00468     unsigned long tickval;
00469     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00470     pthread_t thid;
00471 
00472     if (nstick == 0)
00473         /* Cannot do aperiodic timing in UVMs */
00474         return -ENODEV;
00475 
00476     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00477     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00478     pthread_attr_setschedpolicy(&thattr,SCHED_FIFO);
00479     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2;
00480     pthread_attr_setschedparam(&thattr,&param);
00481 
00482     if (vml_info.tickval > nstick)
00483         {
00484         fprintf(stderr,"Xenomai/VM: warning: VM tick freq > nucleus tick freq\n");
00485         fprintf(stderr,"          : rounding VM tick to %lu us\n",vml_info.tickval / 1000);
00486         tickval = vml_info.tickval;
00487         }
00488     else
00489         {
00490         tickval = ((nstick + vml_info.tickval - 1) / vml_info.tickval) * vml_info.tickval;
00491 
00492         if (tickval != nstick)
00493             {
00494             fprintf(stderr,"Xenomai/VM: warning: VM tick not a multiple of nucleus tick\n");
00495             fprintf(stderr,"          : rounding VM tick to %lu us\n",tickval / 1000);
00496             }
00497         }
00498 
00499     parms.sec = tickval / 1000000000;
00500     parms.nsec = tickval % 1000000000;
00501     parms.tickhandler = tickhandler;
00502     parms.syncflag = 0;
00503     parms.ppid = getpid();
00504 
00505     pthread_create(&thid,&thattr,&xnarch_timer_thread,&parms);
00506     pthread_sync_rt(&parms.syncflag);
00507     pthread_start_rt(vml_timer_handle);
00508 
00509     return 0;
00510 }
00511 
00512 static inline void xnarch_leave_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00513 }
00514 
00515 static inline void xnarch_enter_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00516 }

00518 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00519                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb) {
00520     vml_current = in_tcb;
00521     __pthread_activate_vm(in_tcb->khandle,out_tcb->khandle);
00522 }
00523 
00524 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00525                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00526     vml_current = next_tcb;
00527     __pthread_cancel_vm(dead_tcb->khandle,next_tcb->khandle);
00528 }
00529 
00530 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00531 
00532     __pthread_cancel_vm(dead_tcb->khandle,NULL);
00533 }

00536     /* Handled by the in-kernel nucleus */
00537 }
00538 
00539 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {

00541 }
00542 
00543 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00544                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00545                                          const char *name)
00546 {
00547     struct sched_param param;
00548 
00549     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00550 
00551     if (sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param) < 0 ||
00552         pthread_info_rt(&vml_info) < 0)
00553         {
00554         perror("Xenomai/VM");
00555         exit(1);
00556         }
00557 
00558     pthread_init_rt("vmroot",tcb,&tcb->khandle);
00559     pthread_migrate_rt(FUSION_RTAI_DOMAIN);
00560 
00561     tcb->name = name;
00562     vml_root = vml_current = tcb;
00563 }
00564 
00565 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00566 
00567     tcb->khandle = NULL;
00568 }
00569 
00570 static void *xnarch_thread_trampoline (void *cookie)
00571 
00572 {
00573     xnarchtcb_t *tcb = (xnarchtcb_t *)cookie;
00574 
00575     if (!setjmp(tcb->rstenv))
00576         {
00577         /* After this, we are controlled by the in-kernel nucleus. */
00578         pthread_create_rt(tcb->name,tcb,tcb->ppid,&tcb->syncflag,&tcb->khandle);
00579         pthread_migrate_rt(FUSION_RTAI_DOMAIN);
00580         }
00581 
00582     xnarch_setimask(tcb->imask);
00583 
00584     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->thread);
00585 
00586     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00587 
00588     return NULL;
00589 }
00590 
00591 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00592                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00593                                        void *cookie,
00594                                        int imask,
00595                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00596                                        char *name)
00597 {
00598     struct sched_param param;
00599     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00600 
00601     if (tcb->khandle)   /* Restarting thread */
00602         {
00603         pthread_kill(tcb->thid,XNARCH_SIG_RESTART);
00604         return;
00605         }
00606 
00607     tcb->imask = imask;
00608     tcb->entry = entry;
00609     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00610     tcb->thread = thread;
00611     tcb->name = name;
00612     tcb->ppid = getpid();
00613     tcb->syncflag = 0;
00614 
00615     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00616     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00617     pthread_attr_setschedpolicy(&thattr,SCHED_FIFO);
00618     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00619     pthread_attr_setschedparam(&thattr,&param);
00620     pthread_create(&tcb->thid,&thattr,&xnarch_thread_trampoline,tcb);
00621 
00622     pthread_sync_rt(&tcb->syncflag);
00623 }
00624 
00625 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00626     /* Handled by the in-kernel nucleus */
00627 }
00628 
00629 int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00630 
00631 {
00632     spl_t s;
00633     splhigh(s);
00634     splexit(!!imask);
00635     return !!s;
00636 }

00651 }
00652 
00653 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp)
00654 
00655 {
00656     while (!*flagp)
00657         {
00658         struct timespec ts;
00659         ts.tv_sec = 0;
00660         ts.tv_nsec = 10000000;
00661         nanosleep(&ts,NULL);
00662         }
00663 }
00664 
00665 static inline void xnarch_escalate (void) {
00666 
00667     void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00668     xnpod_schedule_handler();
00669 }

00671 #define xnarch_notify_ready()  /* Nullified */
00672 #define xnarch_notify_shutdown() /* Nullified */
00673 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00674 
00675 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00682     return ts;

00689 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00690     unsigned long long t;
00691     pthread_time_rt(&t);
00692     return t;
00693 }
00694 
00695 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_tsc (void) {
00696     return xnarch_get_cpu_time();
00697 }

00699 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00700     return vml_info.cpufreq;

00703 static inline void xnarch_halt (const char *emsg) {
00704     fprintf(stderr,"Xenomai/VM: fatal: %s\n",emsg);
00705     fflush(stderr);
00706     xnarch_exit_handler(SIGKILL);
00707     exit(99);
00708 }
